body:
> or we can improve the FlinkPulsarProducer to accept a `Map<String, Object>` settings for Producer and use `loadConf` to build the producer.

I agree!
I'm fixing one last issue in this change regarding the hostname verification that gets enabled by default. That's why the tests are currently failing with TLS enabled
Test was fixed in e4fc42da737f5d62bb4d19e2d306a1d7101ba9bf and 1921bd98f20991248892717bbcfc102545e7c49c
Test was fixed in e4fc42da737f5d62bb4d19e2d306a1d7101ba9bf and 1921bd98f20991248892717bbcfc102545e7c49c
If no one is actively working on this issue I'll take it up.

run cpp tests
run java8 tests

rerun java8 tests
rerun integration tests

rerun java8 tests
rerun integration tests

> @tuteng
> 
> overall looks good. can you try to add a test for it?
> 
> you can check `pulsar-client-tools-test` to see how we test `CmdFunctions`.

I did not find the relevant test in `CmdFunctions`, but i added the relevant tests in `PulsarAdminToolTest`. Please review the code again, thanks. @sijie
I am not aware of anyone working on this. so feel free to pick it up

With help form @jerrypeng , I have been able to get pass the issue by changing the following properties
```
managedLedgerDefaultAckQuorum: 2
managedLedgerDefaultEnsembleSize: 3
managedLedgerDefaultWriteQuorum: 2
```
to
```
managedLedgerDefaultAckQuorum: 2
managedLedgerDefaultEnsembleSize: 2
managedLedgerDefaultWriteQuorum: 2
```
Our pulsar cluster is on kubernetes with 3 bookies, 3 zookeepers and 3 brokers. 
It might help you narrow down the issue.

run cpp tests
run integration tests

@oliverisaac - 

this is a jetty bug when broker running on a 1-cpu-core machine. you can configure `numHttpServerThreads` to be more than 2 to get around this bug. The bug is fixed and will be released as part of 2.3.1 release.

> retest this please

Thanks @jiazhai . There were examples in the base pulsar directory which i hadn't caught in the first version because I was running all the tests from pulsar-flink directory 

All checks have passed now

I was sick the other day and didn't pay attention to the mail.Your suggestion is correct and can be followed by the operation of the second email.Thanks for your answer.

Glad to hear your question is resolved by setting `numHttpServerThreads`
